definition: circle/round/circular/spherical/(of the moon) full/unit of Chinese currency (yuan)/tactful/to make consistent and whole (the narrative of a dream or a lie)

square/power or involution (math.)/upright/honest/fair and square/direction/side/party (to a contract, dispute etc)/place/method/prescription (medicine)/just when/only or just/classifier for square things/abbr. for square or cubic meter

sentences.english: Chinese ancient copper coins have a square hole inside a circle.
sentences.chinese: 中國古代銅錢的形狀是外圓內方的。

sentences.english: Safety management about the velvet glove.
sentences.chinese: 安全管理講究外圓內方。

definition: to follow through/to carry through to the end
lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
when things reach an extreme, they can only move in the opposite direction (idiom)
after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life
toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
